intro: Chrysanthemum halleri, commonly known as the alpine chrysanthemum, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which appear in late summer to early autumn, range in color from white to pale yellow. Chrysanthemum halleri is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates.
